bug.author: JoanFM
bug.summary: HubIO not building images with base of local image
bug.description: When running unit tests for PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jina-ai/jina/pull/968>#968</denchmark-link> , since communication layer has been changed, running even a dry run with a docker image running some old version of jina gives errors. Then is where it is shown the need to change the image of jinaai/jina:devel to jinaai/jina:test-pip (Another question is if what we really have to test is the ability to obtain jinaai/jina:devel (if this is the case we have a little problem)) jinaai/jina:test-pip is created by our CI to have an image with the codebase that is being tested. When this changes are applied, the tests of hubio still fail with a different message: FAILED tests/unit/docker/test_hub_build.py::test_hub_build_pull - docker.errors.BuildError: manifest for jinaai/jina:test-pip not found: manifest unknown: manifest unknown (Note that I have changed some names and paths for the tests) But when I locally run : docker build -f Dockerfile -t jinahub/pod.encoder.dummy_mwu_encoder:0.0.6 . inside the hub-mwu folder, the image is successfully built. This last comment leads me to the conclusion that there is some discrepancy between hubio and the docker client. â”†Issue is synchronized with this <denchmark-link:https://jinaai.atlassian.net/browse/JINACORE-240>Jira Task</denchmark-link> by <denchmark-link:https://www.unito.io/learn-more>Unito</denchmark-link>
